summary:
Finland, officially the Republic of Finland, is a Nordic country in Northern Europe. It borders Sweden, Norway, and Russia, with two gulfs to the west and south. Finland covers 338,145 square kilometers and has 5.6 million people, with Helsinki as its capital. Most Finns speak Finnish as their first language. The country's climate ranges from humid continental in the south to boreal in the north, with lots of forests and lakes.

First settled around 9000 BC, Finland has a rich history. It was part of Sweden, then became an autonomous duchy under Russia in 1809. Finland gained independence in 1917 after the Russian Revolution and became a republic in 1919. During World War II, Finland fought against the Soviet Union and Nazi Germany, losing some territory but keeping its freedom.

Finland transformed from an agricultural to an industrial and advanced economy after the war. It joined
title: Finland
